pages.text: The $(item)Plastic Mixer/$ is a machine used to convert $(l:components/plastic)Liquid Plastic/$ into the solid $(thing)Plastic/$ used in crafting, or vice versa.$(p)Melting $(thing)Plastic/$ requires $(l:base_concepts/heat)Heat/$ (150Â°C), but solidifying $(thing)Plastic/$ does $(italic)not/$ require Heat, just $(4)red/$ / $(2)green/$ / $(1)blue/$ $(item)Dyes/$ (other than $(item)White Plastic/$, which does not need dyes).

pages.title: Solidifying Plastic
pages.text: Open up the $(bold)Plastic Selection/$ GUI tab: you will see a  panel with 16 buttons. Click the button of the $(thing)Plastic/$ color you want, and the dye required will be mixed with the $(l:components/plastic)Liquid Plastic/$ and solidify into one piece of $(item)Plastic/$ in the output slot.$(p)The $(bold)Lock Selection/$ button locks in the next color of $(item)Plastic/$ selected, to make this mixer continually produce a specific color of plastic.

pages.title: Redstone Options
pages.text: In addition to the default $(thing)Redstone/$ options (requiring a signal to run, and requiring no signal to run), the $(item)Plastic Mixer/$ also has a $(bold)Select Plastic on Signal/$ mode.$(p)In this mode the selected $(item)Plastic/$ color will be set from the $(#f00)redstone signal/$ level. E.g. for level 0, Black Plastic, level 1, Red Plastic, and so on, corresponding to the order of buttons in the side tab.

pages.title: CraftTweaker
pages.text: The $(item)Plastic Mixer/$ has $(l:https://minecraft.curseforge.com/projects/crafttweaker)CraftTweaker/$ support: alternative plastic fluid inputs can be added and removed, with definable fluid->solid ratios. Follow the link below for more information.
